Considering your interest in Young Frankenstein, which had a playful and romantic vibe, I'd recommend "Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon". If you're looking for something else, I think "In Our Time" could be a great fit as well. With its romantic storyline and historical setting during World War II, it might scratch that itch for a charming love story.

I think "The Rules of Attraction" might be just the ticket for you! This 1987 classic is a wild ride of love, lust, and drama set in the world of privileged college students. With a star-studded cast including Fred Savage, Faye Dunaway, and Eric Stoltz, it's sure to keep you entertained.

If that doesn't quite strike your fancy, I'd also recommend "The Way Back Home". This heartwarming spiritual drama explores themes of love, loss, and self-discovery in the beautiful setting of Central Florida. With a talented cast including Danny Nucci and Ruby Dee, it's a great choice for anyone looking for a thought-provoking film with a strong emotional core.

I think I have just the thing for you! Have you considered "Island of the Blue Dolphins"? It's a beautiful and poignant film about a young Native American girl who finds solace in nature after being abandoned on an island. The story is stunningly shot and explores themes of loneliness, resilience, and connection to the natural world.

Alternatively, if you're in the mood for something a bit more...unconventional, "Vampyres" might be right up your alley! This 1966 horror film tells the tale of two vampire sisters who prey on unsuspecting travelers in the English countryside. It's a cult classic with a unique atmosphere and some great performances from Bessie Love and Michael Byrne.
